name: Anaximander
quote: Into that from which things take their rise they pass away once more, as is ordained; for they make reparation and satisfaction to one another for the injustice according to the appointed time.

name: Parmenides
quote: For it is the same thing that can be thought and that can be.

name: Parmenides
quote: It is indifferent to me where I am to begin, for there shall I return again.

name: Socrates
quote: What I do not know I do not think I know either

name: Socrates
quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.

name: Socrates
quote: I only wish that wisdom were the kind of thing that flowed … from the vessel that was full to the one that was empty.

name: Socrates
quote: Wonder is the feeling of a philosopher, and philosophy begins in wonder.

name: Socrates
quote: It would be better for me... that multitudes of men should disagree with me rather than that I, being one, should be out of harmony with myself.

name: Pythagoras
quote: There is geometry in the humming of the strings, there is music in the spacing of the spheres.

name: Socrates
quote: I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think.

name: Plato
quote: I shall assume that your silence gives consent

name: Plato
quote: The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.

name: Plato
quote: All that is said by any of us can only be imitation and representation.

name: Plato
quote: Knowledge is the food of the soul; and we must take care, my friend, that the Sophist does not deceive us when he praises what he sells, like the dealers wholesale or retail who sell the food of the body; for they praise indiscriminately all their goods, without knowing what are really beneficial or hurtful.

name: Plato
quote: Oh dear Pan and all the other Gods of this place, grant that I may be beautiful inside.

name: Aristotle
quote: All men by nature desire to know. An indication of this is the delight we take in our senses; for even apart from their usefulness they are loved for themselves; and above all others the sense of sight.

name: Aristotle
quote: That which is desirable on its own account and for the sake of knowing it is more of the nature of wisdom than that which is desirable on account of its results.

name: Aristotle
quote: It is the mark of an educated man to look for precision in each class of things just so far as the nature of the subject admits; it is evidently equally foolish to accept probable reasoning from a mathematician and to demand from a rhetorician scientific proofs.

name: Aristotle
quote: Piety requires us to honor truth above our friends.

name: Heraclitus
quote: The path up and down are one and the same.

name: Aristotle
quote: Man is by nature a political animal.

name: Aristotle
quote: Wit is cultured insolence.

name: Aristotle
quote: All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsions, habit, reason, passion and desire

name: Aristotle
quote: Man, when perfected, is the best of animals, but when separated from law and justice, he is the worst of all.

name: Aristotle
quote: Knowledge of the fact differs from knowledge of the reason for the fact.

name: Aristotle
quote: A whole is that which has beginning, middle, and end.

name: Augustine of Hippo
quote: An unjust law is no law at all.

name: Augustine of Hippo
quote: Beauty is indeed a good gift of God; but that the good may not think it a great good, God dispenses it even to the wicked.

name: Augustine of Hippo
quote: For when God said, “Let there be light, and there was light,” if we are justified in understanding in this light the creation of the angels, then certainly they were created partakers of the eternal light which is the unchangeable Wisdom of God, by which all things were made, and whom we call the only-begotten Son of God

name: Heraclitus
quote: Though wisdom is common, yet the many live as if they had a wisdom of their own.

name: Augustine of Hippo
quote: The Heavenly City outshines Rome, beyond comparison. There, instead of victory, is truth; instead of high rank, holiness; instead of peace, felicity; instead of life, eternity.

name: Augustine of Hippo
quote: If there is something more excellent than the truth, then that is God; if not, then truth itself is God.

name: Augustine of Hippo
quote: As a youth I prayed, "Give me chastity and continence, but not right now."

name: Marcus Aurelius
quote: He was a man who looked at what ought to be done, not to the reputation which is got by a man's acts

name: Marcus Aurelius
quote: There is a limit to the time assigned you, and if you don't use it to free yourself it will be gone and never return.

name: Marcus Aurelius
quote: This thou must always bear in mind, what is the nature of the whole...

name: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Never esteem anything as of advantage to you that will make you break your word or lose your self-respect.

name: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The universe is change; our life is what our thoughts make it.

name: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Remember this— that there is a proper dignity and proportion to be observed in the performance of every act of life.

name: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Reverence the gods, and help men. Short is life.

name: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Soon you will have forgotten the world, and soon the world will have forgotten you.

name: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.

name: Heraclitus
quote: All entities come to be in accordance with this Logos.

name: Diogenes
quote: The noblest people are those despising wealth, learning, pleasure and life; esteeming above them poverty, ignorance, hardship and death.

name: Diogenes
quote: Aristotle dines when it seems good to King Philip, but Diogenes when he himself pleases.

name: Diogenes
quote: It is not that I am mad, it is only that my head is different from yours.

name: Diogenes
quote: If you are to be kept right, you must possess either good friends or red-hot enemies. The one will warn you, the other will expose you.

name: Diogenes
quote: Self-taught poverty is a help toward philosophy, for the things which philosophy attempts to teach by reasoning, poverty forces us to practice.

name: Xenophanes
quote:
Mortals deem that the gods are begotten as they are,
and have clothes like theirs, and voice and form.

name: Xenophanes
quote:
Ethiopians say that their gods are snubnosed and black
Thracians that they are pale and red-haired.

name: Xenophanes
quote: There is one god, greatest among gods and men, similar to mortals neither in shape nor in thought.

name: Xenophanes
quote: For all things are from the earth and to the earth all things come in the end.

name: Heraclitus
quote: No man ever steps in the same river twice.

name: Seneca
quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.

name: Seneca
quote: No man can have a peaceful life who thinks too much about lengthening it.

name: Seneca
quote: Withdraw into yourself, as far as you can. Associate with those who will make a better man of you. Welcome those whom you yourself can improve. The process is mutual; for men learn while they teach.

name: Seneca
quote: You do not know where death awaits you; so be ready for it everywhere.

name: Seneca
quote: Man is a reasoning animal.

name: Seneca
quote: All art is but imitation of nature.

name: Plotinus
quote: Perhaps, the good and the beautiful are the same, and must be investigated by one and the same process; and in like manner the base and the evil.

name: Plotinus
quote: It is now time, leaving every object of sense far behind, to contemplate, by a certain ascent, a beauty of a much higher order; a beauty not visible to the corporeal eye, but alone manifest to the brighter eye of the soul, independent of all corporeal aid.

name: Plotinus
quote: Hence beauty is established in multitude when the many is reduced into one, and in this case it communicates itself both to the parts and to the whole. But when a particular one, composed from similar parts, is received it gives itself to the whole, without departing from the sameness and integrity of its nature.

name: Plotinus
quote: Pleasure and distress, fear and courage, desire and aversion, where have these affections and experiences their seat? Clearly, either in the Soul alone, or in the Soul as employing the body, or in some third entity deriving from both.

name: Plotinus
quote: All teems with symbol; the wise man is the man who in any one thing can read another.

name: Plotinus
quote: We may treat of the Soul as in the body — whether it be set above it or actually within it — since the association of the two constitutes the one thing called the living organism, the Animate.

name: Heraclitus
quote: Everything changes and nothing stands still.

name: Parmenides
quote: Thinking and the thought that it is are the same; for you will not find thinking apart from what is, in relation to which it is uttered.

name: Parmenides
quote: And it is all one to me / Where I am to begin; for I shall return there again.
